contact.group: Centre for Ophthalmology and Visual Science, The University of Western Australia

publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with Stargardt Macular Dystrophy caused by the c.768G > T and c.6079C > T mutations in ABCA4

donor.disease_description: Autosomal recessive Stargardt disease (STGD1) is a form of juvenile macular degeneration caused by mutations in the ABCA4 gene.

genomic_modifications.description: Compound heterozygous for ABCA4 c.768G > T and c.6079C > T

genomic_characterisation.summary: Normal diploid karyotype confirmed by SNP array at passage 11.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: Episomal iPSC Reprogramming Plasmid kit (SC900A-1, System Biosciences)

ethics.institutional_HREC: University of Western Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
